author: Ronald

review: My needs for this little black box were minimal. I wanted the device for viewing my Amazon video library and prime movies. I also wanted it for mirroring my iPhone and iPad via airplay.Well working in reverse mirroring my devices was easy to setup and works flawlessly. Shockingly perfect. So easy that it's almost worth the $100 just for that...almost. I love this. I watch my Lynda.com content on the TV and that's tremendously better than using the app on my device or PC.The good: When the fire tv works and works well. All my Amazon content is right there in my face just as I want it. The voice search works well, controls work as they should, moving through the content and apps is speed, video is perfectThe bad:Nothing but troubles with sound. Sometimes there isn't any sound whether scrolling content or watching video. Other times I hear menu clicks but no audio at all, no device feedback, no audio during playback. Each time unplugging the fire tv and plugging it back in resolves the issue but the act gets old as I have a pretty elaborate home theater setup and I need to get on my belly  to get at the fire tv to cycle the power. For reference I'm using HDMI from the Fire TV to a Yamaha RX-A2030 Receiver.I have researched some internet forums, I am not alone with this issue. I keep hoping for a software update to resolve this.

review: My wife and I elected to get rid of cable (just cannot justify the cost since we don't watch much television, nor do we care for much that is on) and decided to go with the Amazon Fire.  We absolutely LOVE it.  So easy, efficient and fun!  I have resorted to buying all of my movies/Television shows now from Amazon and playing them on the Fire. The Netflix application also works well.  And don't forget the voice feature, which is such a nice luxury to have.
